DOC.brief_summary: In an individual cancer patient extensive genetic and phenotypic variation exists between and within tumor lesions. Tumour load in NET patients can be measured with fluorine-18-L-dihydroxyphenylalaninepositron emission tomography (18F-DOPA-PET) scan. This aim of the study is to investigate heterogeneity between tumor lesions within patients with intestinal NET by determining the differences in tracer uptake measured on a 18F- DOPA-PET scan retrospectively.
DOC.brief_title: Heterogeneity of Metastatic Neuroendocrine Tumors as Determined With 18F-dihydroxyphenylalanine-PET /CT, a Retrospective Analysis
DOC.detailed_description: In an individual cancer patient extensive genetic and phenotypic variation exists between and within tumor lesions. Tumour load in NET patients can be measured with fluorine-18-L-dihydroxyphenylalanine positron emission tomography (18F-DOPA-PET) scan. This aim of the study is to investigate heterogeneity between tumor lesions within patients with intestinal NET by determining the differences in tracer uptake measured on a 18F- DOPA-PET scan in retrospect.
DOC.criteria: age â‰¥18 years diagnosis of intestinal NET diagnosed by a dedicated NET specialist more than one positive lesion on the 18FDOPAPET scan. available CTscan within 6 months before or after the 18FDOPAPETscan. no clinical data available at the UMCG, besides the results of the DOPA PET scan.
